frame.name: Terms_of_agreement
frame.definition:
<def-root>A condition that is set out in an <fen>Agreement</fen> imposes <fen>Requirements</fen> on a <fen>Party</fen> or parties, with respect to some <fen>Regulated_entity</fen>. If the conditions are not met, the <fen>Agreement</fen> as a whole ceases to be valid or, more specifically, a <fen>Desired_state_of_affairs</fen> cannot occur. (The <fen>Desired_state_of_affairs</fen> typically is an interaction between the parties that benefits one or both sides.)
<ex>Breach of contract occurs where one of the parties fails to perform any one of the <fex name="Agreement">contract</fex> <t>terms</t> .</ex> <ex>Breach of contract occurs where one of the parties fails to perform any one of the contract <fex name="req"><t>terms</t></fex> .</ex>
<ex><fex name="req">What</fex> <m>are</m> <fex name="par">your</fex> <t>conditions</t> <fex name="Desired_state_of_affairs">for a peaceful settlement?</fex></ex>
<ex>Please read <fex name="par">our</fex> <t>Conditions</t> <fex name="des">of Sale</fex> carefully</ex> <ex>Please read our <fex name="req"><t>Conditions</t></fex> of Sale carefully</ex>
<ex>We will verify compliance with the <fex name="reg">financial</fex> <t>terms</t> <fex name="Agreement">of the contract</fex>.</ex> <ex>We will verify compliance with the financial <t><fex name="req">terms</fex></t> of the contract.</ex>
<ex>The Engineering Division has violated the <fex name="reg">seniority</fex> <t>provision</t> <fex name="Agreement">of the collective bargaining agreement.</fex></ex> <ex>The Engineering Division has violated the seniority<t> <fex name="req">provision</fex></t> of the collective bargaining agreement.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agreement
FE.definition:
<def-root>A mutual commitment to an obligation made by two or more parties.
<ex>The right to remove tenants ' fixtures may be given by the <t>terms</t> <fex name="Agreement">of the lease</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Regulated_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A salient entity, an activity or behavior by the parties to the agreement to which a particular stipulation pertains.
<ex>Many believed that the <fex name="reg">military</fex> <t>terms</t> of the armistice made the resumption of hostilities virtually impossible for Germany.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Requirements
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Requirements</fen> that a particular stipulation of the <fen>Agreement</fen> imposes on one or both of the parties.
<ex>Each time you use the site, a <t>condition</t> of use <m>is</m> <fex name="req">that you comply with the above terms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Desired_state_of_affairs
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event or state of affairs that is desirable to some or all of the parties to the <fen>Agreement</fen> and which is conditional on the <fen>Requirements</fen> being met.
<ex>What are your <t>conditions</t> <fex name="des">of Sale</fex>?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Party
FE.definition:
<def-root>A party who demands that certain <fen>Requirements</fen> be met before they will enter into an <fen>Agreement</fen> or allow a <fen>Desired_state_of_affairs</fen> to be realized.
<ex><fex name="par">Our</fex> political and military <t>terms</t> of peace will be designed to prevent a repetition of Germany's misdeeds</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the <fen>Requirements</fen> that are imposed by the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
<ex>No reason why SU would have to impose <fex name="scr">harsh</fex> <t>terms</t>, the lease payments would pay the bank loan used to buy the stadium.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: condition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a state of affairs that must exist before something else is possible.

lexUnit.name: stipulation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: demand that is part of a bargain or agreement.

lexUnit.name: provision.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition or requirement in a legal document.

lexUnit.name: clause.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a particular and separate article, stipulation, or proviso in a treaty, bill, or contract

lexUnit.name: parameter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a limit or boundary which defines the scope of a particular process or activity.
